newsitem.title: JAPAN: Sony earnings jump sharply thanks to good sales.
newsitem.headline: Sony earnings jump sharply thanks to good sales.

text.p: Consumer electronics giant Sony Corp said on Thursday its half-year net profit more than tripled thanks to robust sales in its electronics and entertainment businesses.
Sony said it expects the upward trend to continue and forecast its group operating profit would reach a record 305 billion yen ($2.72 billion) for the full business year ending March 31, 1997.

Sony's group net income, which includes that of Sony and its units worldwide, shot up to 51.74 billion yen ($461 million) in the six months ended September from 16.09 billion yen ($144 million) a year earlier.
Its group sales in the same half-year period were up 23 percent at 2.53 trillion yen ($22.5 billion).
Sales in the group's electronics business and the entertainment business grew sharply, but revenues from its insurance and financing business fell.
The rise in sales in the electronics division was due to the company's cost-cutting and strong sales overseas which were helped by the yen's fall, Sony said.
A weaker yen makes Japanese companies' products more competitive abroad because it makes them cheaper in terms of foreign currency.
In the entertainment business, sales grew due to the weak yen as well as strong sales, it said.
Sony's entertainment group includes Sony Pictures Entertainment, the umbrella company for Columbia and Tri-Star Pictures and Sony Music Entertainment.
Industry analysts say Sony Pictures has struggled to achieve the same performance as its peers, with a big part of its profits coming from television operations rather than the film unit.
The performance of its films "The Cable Guy", "The Fan" and "Multiplicity" this summer was disappointing, they said.
